column1: '''Harvest of Sorrow''' is a bonus track on [[Blind Guardian]]'s [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]-themed album ''[[Nightfall in Middle-Earth]]''. The song tells about the [[Narn i Chîn Húrin (tale)|Children of Húrin]].
==Lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
She is gone leaves are falling down
The tear maiden will not return
The seal of oblivion is broken
And a pure love's been turned into sin
At the dawn of our living time
Hope may cover all cries
Truth lurks hidden in the shadows
Dreams might be filled with lies
Soon there will be night
Pain remains inside
Suddenly (oh) it seemed so clear
All the blindness was taken away
She closed her eyes and she called out my name
She was never ever never ever seen again
Harvest of sorrow
In a frozen world full of cries
When the ray of light shrinks
Shall cold winter nights begin
She is gone and I fall from grace
No healing charm covers my wounds
Fooled's the dawn and so I am
Fooled by life and a bitter doom
To bring you the end of the day
At the dawn of our living time
Hope it soon will pass by
Facing a darkness
I stand (alone)
Harvest of sorrow
In a frozen world full of cries
When the ray of light shrinks
Shall cold winter nights begin
</poem>
